properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 7:10PM CST until January 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as
30 below zero.

* WHERE...Dunn, Mercer and Oliver counties.

* WHEN...From 2 AM CST /1 AM MST/ to noon CST /11 AM MST/
Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills are expected to
return Tuesday night through Thursday.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that the combination of very cold air
and wind will generate low wind chills. This will result in frost
bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you
must be outdoors, make sure you dress accordingly.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM CST /1 AM MST/ TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TUESDAY
